body.p: “See a dog’s-bane with two pods open and partially curved backward on each side “,” but a third not yet open. This soon opens and scatters its down and seeds in my chamber. The outside is a dull reddish or mahogany-color “,” but the inside is a singularly polished very pale brown. The innter bark of this makes a strong twine like that of milkweed “,” but there is not so much of it.”
PE 11, pg. 306 / 23 April-6 September 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:27 / T vol. # XXI / PDF # XIV / JVIII & JIX
